p: Despite species distributions are generally predicted to shift towards higher latitudes and altitudes as a result of climate changed induced shifts of bioclimatic variables [ 77, 80] some components of assemblages can move in the opposite direction, or simply do not exhibit a retraction of their ranges [ 81]. These species-specific responses could uncouple important species interactions, such as the regulation of population abundance, nutrient cycling and habitat creation, affecting ecosystem processes and function [ 82].
